items.title: The Royal Rajpoot Wedding - Aradhana & Divraj
items.summary: Coming back from the amazing pre-wedding mehendi day of Aradhana, this is the story of their wedding day which started…
items.content_html:
Coming back from the amazing pre-wedding mehendi day of Aradhana, this is the story of their wedding day which started somewhere around the afternoon. The decors from the last day were complete and the stage was being set up for their wedding as I arrived.

Everything had amazing details in their wedding. The setup you see below was made of bamboo sticks. Now, the length of the bamboo sticks wasnâ€™t picked abruptly. It was a multiple of the length of Aradhanaâ€™s fore-arms. She told me they took the measure of her hands before setting it up. Talk about getting everything rightÂ ðŸ™‚

As the sun approached the horizon, it was time for the Safa-tying. Now the Safas of the two families were also different and for a reason. Aradhanaâ€™s family had the one with the long end, almost touching the ground. Divrajâ€™s family on the other hand, had short ends which went till their mid-backs. Two Rajput families, two different traditions. This was another small detail.

Meanwhile, the bride herself was almost ready in the adjacent room!

Probably the youngest of the Thakurs I have ever come acrossÂ ðŸ˜€

And of course, Divraj!

And then the bride arrived!

Stiff competition, I tell youÂ ðŸ˜›

And with that, both families thanked each other for everything. While I couldnâ€™t do it that time, Iâ€™ll say that right here: Thank You, Aradhana & Divraj for this wonderful opportunity to witness, attend and document your precious wedding. Every single moment I saw, every single person I met and every single experience I had was amazing. Thank you for being so detail oriented and taking the time to explain all those details to me. I wish I did justice to this amazing experience and I hope I did succeed in my efforts of putting everything I felt there, in these photographsÂ ðŸ™‚

items.title: The Telugu - Punjabi Fusion Wedding
items.summary: Who says the group photos can't tell a story? The two photos here gets together people from extreme ends of…
items.content_html:
Who says the group photos can't tell a story? The two photos here gets together people from extreme ends of our country, coming together to celebrate love!

And there came Puneet!

All eyes and cameras up!

But look who's here too?

Oh, our very own Rahul in a new avatar!

Everybody welcomed Rahul with warn hugs and wishes

Â 

And it was time to start the ceremony

Â  Â  Â 

And that was the Anand Karaj ceremony. And Puneet was about to become a beautiful Telugu bride in the evening!

Puneet suprizing everyone with her saree charm!

And we had every ceremony's explanations going on as well so that all of us understood everything

With one special ritual in the Telugu wedding being that the groom goes on to leave the ceremony but the bride's brother convinces him and brings him back.

And one special ritual for Puneet wherein she was supposed to be carried in a basket to the mandap!

And with everything else said and done, it was time everyone has been waiting for!

When two best friends get married, fun is never out of the picture and we made sure the photos captured that essence!

The rice were even replaced by rose petals but Puneet & Rahul, just being themselves all the way :D

And with those smiles around and last few family pictures, we decided to call it a day! What a fun two days for me, capturing all the emotions, families, fun, culture and rituals.

items.title: Leh - Ladakh Pre Wedding Engagement Shoot
items.summary: Kashmir. The name is itself sufficient to give you that (not) warm-fuzzy feeling of just packing your bag and go.
items.content_html:
Kashmir. The name is itself sufficient to give you that (not) warm-fuzzy feeling of just packing your bag and go. So when Vidit & Aparna, two globe trotters themselves tossed me this idea of having their pre-wedding shoot in Ladakh, I was equally excited as I was scared. Excited because I knew there can be no better place in India to be for a shoot and scared because I did not know how our bodies will react to the insane altitude and climate of Leh. Lots of sleepless nights of planning later, we found ourselves flying to this destination of dreams. Let me take you through our journey.

The arrival in Kashmir does not require any in-flight announcement. The surreal visuals themselves welcome you to the land of mountains. ProTip: Always have an early morning flight while traveling to mountains. Â After landing on probably the worldâ€™s highest runway, and probably the only one which had pelted stones on either side of it, we went and checked in our beautiful hotel. The plan was to give at least 24 hours to our bodies to acclimatise to the altitude and climate so that no one falls ill.

We had planned long shoot days ahead. Â So while Vidit & Aparna rested, we being photographers do not know the definition of rest.

Â Somehow I believe, the sunlight falls differently in mountains and itâ€™s surreal.

And few hours of recce later, we came back and had some rest & prepared for next dayâ€™s early morning shoot at Shanti Stupa.

And that concluded our morning shoot. Everyone was hungry and the food is a luxury at Leh. Luckily we didnâ€™t have to travel a lot to find food and the â€œChopsticksâ€ catered amazing things nearby. Getting some rest afterward, we head to the famous Magnetic Hill.

Huge mountains, barren land, sun shining brightly

The wind was insane and thatâ€™s not necessarily a bad thing in photographyÂ ðŸ˜€

The sun was setting fast so we had to make use of every light ray possible!

We felt we the first humans to land on Mars! But even there, weâ€™ll make epic photosÂ ðŸ˜‰ That combined with the limited amount of oxygen levels was enough to make everyone tired. We went back to get some rest as next day was reserved for taming the worldâ€™s highest motorable road & the changla pass!

Good morning from the road to Khardungla Pass! Every single sight along the way was a picture in itself. How could we miss the chance to get some wallpapers?Â ðŸ™‚

Â And we were there at Changla pass.

Â It was an incredibly tough terrain and it was impossible to even stand there because of the bone-chilling winds and the scarcity of oxygen in the air. Imagine the Indian Army soldiers who guard the homeland in such terrains every single day.

Â 

And then we reached Khardungla! The highest motorable road in the world!

The climate & the chilling winds allowed us to take limited photos there. Before it can hit any of us, we wrapped up and came back for our next part of our journey. This one was also going to be my favorite partÂ ðŸ˜€ The next morning, we started our journey to the beautiful Pangong Tso lake. Everyone warned us that itâ€™s too cold there and youâ€™ll proabably not find a place to stay, but we went on regardless. How can anyone go to Leh and not to Pangong Tso!

Â And there we were. The serene blue waters of Pangong Tso. No photograph can do justice to what you feel when you first see it.

Â We were to shoot here the next day. I could write a nobel prize winning research paper if I can pen down the calculations going on in my mind that time, in hopes of getting everything right next morning

Â And finally we reached the shore. As told, there was no place to stay we could find nearby. But with a habit of not giving up, we kept on looking and finally found one lone place open in the middle of nowhere. Luckily they had the acommodation and few more people there who were crazy like us to visit Pangong at that time. We were at least sorted! Â Our drive was of around 5 hours and was very challenging on our bodies. Again, rest for that evening and night was required to make sure everyone was able to breathe and walk the next day.

But recce > rest ðŸ˜€ We had to make sure we exactly know everything, every location, the sunlight We had to make sure we exactly know everything, every location, the sunlight, the water currents, approximation of wind and zillion other things in our heads before we put Vidit & Aparna to shoot the next day. So we went on to take our notes!Â 

Â And Pangong Tso welcomed us with open arms and blue waters!

Â  Â  Â  As the sun set, Pangong offered us various colors of itself! One more thing that places like Pangong Tso offer other than the surreal sights of water and mountains is, the sight of our own galaxy. There are very few places you can see the stars and galaxies so clear that you just want to touch them. With tempratures droppign to sub-zero at the night, we had this plan of creating something different with stars and galaxy as the backdrop. When we explained the idea to Vidit & Aparna, they jumped in. We secured our bodies to fight the climate and went on to do our experiments of the night sky at Pangong And we had a totally YES! moment with those photographs that night!Â ðŸ™‚

Next day was the most important one and we had great plans to execute at Pangong during the day. That day was our departure day from there as well so we had to make sure everything was on time as the sun and waters wonâ€™t wait for us!

Â  Â  We wanted to show the surreal scale of nature while not losing the point of what we were there to shoot! While we were in the middle of the shoot, one thing that Aparna, and all of you didnâ€™t know till now was that Vidit, I and Rituraj had a secret surprise for her which was in the picture since the starting. A convinced Aparna who thought Vidit, as always, wouldâ€™ve forgotÂ to carry the promise rings that theyâ€™ve got for themselves was in for a big surprise! We asked both of them to stand back to back and used our secret code to signal Vidit that now was the time! The reaction on Aparnaâ€™s face made it all worth it!Â ðŸ™‚ Â  And then I made my favorite photograph!

And that was the epic story of Vidit & Aparna. We can conveniently call it the worldâ€™s highest pre-wedding shoot ever done. Or the worldâ€™s most crazy shoot. Or the worldâ€™s most challenging or tiring. Whatever you call it, it was a bone-breaking, heart-warming experience and we loved every bit of it. I hope you enjoyed the picturesÂ ðŸ˜€

items.title: Ladakh & Turtuk, India - A Travel Diary
items.summary: Turtuk, the last village of India. Situated right on the Pakistan-India border, turtuk is a very less explored destination (and…
items.content_html: Turtuk, the last village of India. Situated right on the Pakistan-India border, turtuk is a very less explored destination (and maybe why still so beautiful without a sight of plastic litter). Vehicles are prohibited beyond a point and there's only a bridge connecting people of Turtuk to the other side. These girls wanted some chocolates. We bought them and I got a chance to capture their happiness. And their home!

items.title: About Magica
items.summary: Planning your dream wedding? Let us make it magical for you. From exotic destination weddings to absolute private weddings, we…
items.content_html:
Planning your dream wedding? Let us make it magical for you.

From exotic destination weddings to absolute private weddings, we shoot and film everything. You give us your story, we'll make sure it's preserved as ever lasting memories.

Wedding photography which speaks emotions. Every tiny story from your wedding day beautifully captured in well-thought frames and presented to re-live those at any point in time.

Photography is my Passion.

My name is Rish and nearly a decade ago, I quit my corporate job to follow my passion for telling stories through photography.

I founded Magica for documenting amazing stories of people. Stories that move your heart.

Stories that deserve to be told. Stories on film & photos. Over the years, weâ€™ve worked with amazing people across the globe, been part of the biggest days of their lives and made everlasting memories for them. We look forward to creating some for you too!

Follow me on Instagram

items.title: Ansh & Nitika - The Wedding
Kartik & Preetika - Pre Wedding
items.summary: The day started somewhere around afternoon. Like everyone else, K & P were very camera conscious. Beautiful locations and faces…
items.content_html:
The day started somewhere around afternoon. Like everyone else, K & P were very camera conscious. Beautiful locations and faces aside, I was in no way going to get the emotions, had that been the case for too long. So I decided something. I risked the time and the effect it was having on the light around & I put my camera down. I tried to make them comfortable and assure Kartik that he doesnâ€™t have to worry about how heâ€™s looking in the photographs. It took me around 2 hours to get them into the â€œzoneâ€. But it was all worth it!

And then the graph of amazing pictures grew exponentially

So that was Day 1. I started with two very difficult to work with people, put in *a lot* of effort to get them into the zone and ultimately had the photographs I was happy with. That last thing has to happen at the end of every shoot and Iâ€™m glad it did with the Day 1.

Next comes the Day 2. We decided to keep it the more lively, brighter kind of day. So we chose things accordingly. From places to props, from attires to expressions, everything had to scream LIFE!

And the lady luck was on our side as well. We found this beautiful location to shoot with, just around the evening.

And those were Kartik & Preetika.

items.title: Sneha & Dhruva - A Kanpur Wedding Story
items.summary: Sneha and Dhruvaâ€™s story goes back to the college days where the days went with being together and late nights…
items.content_html:
Sneha and Dhruvaâ€™s story goes back to the college days where the days went with being together and late nights for sorting the fights between themÂ ðŸ™‚Â Both being great friends and the members ofÂ Saurabhâ€˜s gang, were miles apart in nature. But still, love found its way like it always does. The moment their wedding date got finalized, I was called to photograph their journey and story from Delhi to Kanpur. Both being friends ofÂ Saurabh & Deeksha, I wasnâ€™t asked, but informed that Iâ€™m shooting their weddingÂ ðŸ˜›Â And I obliged! Let me take you to Snehaâ€™s home in Kanpur where I was pretty excited, seeing the environment and the energy that surrounded her morning rituals. This is as simple and emotionally colorful as it can get!

After everyone was done with the initial rituals, Sneha was supposed to be taken to the nearby temple. If you havenâ€™t been to Kanpur and especially in the streets of the town, you wouldnâ€™t know that they are actually very emaciated. That said, there were numerous shops all around with kids running all over the street. That made me excited about the photo-making possibilites there.

And while they were moving forward, I was actually moving backwards, photographing them. While I have mastered the art of making photographs walking in opposite direction over the years, the streets of Kanpur were a challenge. However, the colors, the patterns and the opportunities around seemed endless to my eyes!

And this being probably the most interesting rituals ever, Snehaâ€™s brother was to pour water on her head through the pictured arrangement. Now Iâ€™m not sure what exactly that signified but I saw the childhood revenges getting justifiedÂ ðŸ˜›

Snehaâ€™s brother probably went a little over the board and wanted to finish it off by pouring all the water. Everyone else was trying to stop him thoughÂ ðŸ˜€

And it was time for some portraits! I couldnâ€™t have missed taking the portraits among the interesting streets, colors, patterns of this beautiful bride to be!

The afternoon ended with the lunch and now it was time for the wedding. I arrived at the venue much before time since I wanted to shoot Dhruvaâ€™s enthusiasm from the very beginning!

And it all started when the friendly gang arrived!

Not sure about everyone else, but the band-lead was sure having a great timeÂ ðŸ˜›

I seem to have some weird special relationship with rain. A minute before everything was fine and a second after, it started pouring. However, that didnâ€™tâ€™ deter these guys even a bit from dancing in their best friendâ€™s wedding!

Saurabh is returning the favor from his own wedding!

And amidst all the rain, chaos and madness, Sneha arrived.

I wish I couldâ€™ve put sound in this pictureÂ ðŸ˜€

And that was Sneha & Dhruvaâ€™s wedding from Kanpur. Unfortunately, I wasnâ€™t able to cover the full wedding because of the delays and the fact that all their friends and I had return tickets booked from there but nevertheless, I enjoyed every bit of their wedding & tried to put all the love and emotions I felt there in these photographs. Thank You, Dhruva and Sneha for letting me be a part of your wedding! Ending the post with Riaâ€™s photograph which was the last one I made, just before stepping out of the train at New DelhiÂ ðŸ™‚

items.title: Wedding Films
A Suryagarh Palace Destination Wedding - Day 2
items.summary: Welcome to the second day of Jasmin & Mayankâ€™s destination wedding in Jaisalmer. We got over with the fun filledÂ Day…
items.content_html:
Welcome to the second day of Jasmin & Mayankâ€™s destination wedding in Jaisalmer. We got over with the fun filledÂ Day 1Â and the next day came sooner than I expected. An early morning call woke me up and I was off to photograph the first event of the morning.

The morning started with the chuda ceremony of Jasmin. Â 

The sun had just risen and the wedding venue was being set up.

While I had the time to get some cool lehenga shots with the backdrop of this colossal palace!

And it was time for the bride to get ready!

Jasmin put a surprize element in Mayankâ€™s sherwani which was the pic of their late maternal granny. She has been very important to them and they wanted her to be the part of their wedding in some wayÂ ðŸ™‚

Meanwhile Mayank was getting ready as well

Mayank, the groom!

But of course, Jasmin was taking a little long in getting readyÂ ðŸ˜€

And there she was, the show-stopper!

And while Jamsmin got ready, the folks outside were already dancing with the baarat

The palace backdrop gave every picture the feel of a painting!

And Mayank cleverly dodged his mother-in-lawâ€™s welcomeÂ ðŸ˜€

Alongside this beautiful venue in the middle of a pool, Jasmine was just waiting to be escorted.

The look in Mayankâ€™s eyes explains everything

And they both exchanged the wedding vows.

Soon after the commencement of Hindu wedding ceremony, everyone was headed to the Gurdwarafor their Sikh tradition wedding.

And that was Jasmin & Mayankâ€™s beautiful, fun & amazing destination wedding in Jaisalmer, India. It wasnâ€™t just a wedding. It was an experience in itself.
